SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.flemil.control
Class Style

java.lang.Object
  org.flemil.control.Style

public class Style
extends java.lang.Object

Class that represents the display styling for an item. Specifies this such as the background color, foreground color and theming color. The theming color is the color used for the title and the Menu bar.

Author:
Solomon Kariri

THEME_BACKGROUND

public static final byte THEME_BACKGROUND
The fill color that is thematic and assumed as the background fill for all Windows. This is not an image and is used to fill a rect before the there foreground image is drawn

See Also:
THEME_FOREGROUND, Constant Field Values

THEME_LIGHTING

public static final byte THEME_LIGHTING
The lighting criteria to be used for creating the Theme foreground Image. Should be one of the values ImageFactory.LIGHT_TOP, ImageFactory.LIGHT_BOTTOM, ImageFactory.FRONT, ImageFactory.LIGHT_BEHIND

Constant Field Values

public static final byte TITLE_BAR_LIGHTING

setProperty

public void setProperty(byte propId,
                        java.lang.Object val)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets a property of a Style. The properties that can be set are specified by constants which are accessible as public static members of the Style class. The property value is the value for the property which take values governed by the following rules.

For color properties, that is, backgrounds and foregrounds the property values object is an Integer object initialized with a value representing the color in RGB format. For example the colors red, grren and blue will be represented by the following initializations respectively: new Integer(0xff0000); new Integer(0x00ff00); new Integer(0x0000ff);

For outline the property values object will be a Byte() object initialized using either of the two outline/border types static members of the Style class. Therefore for block borders you use new Byte(Style.BLOCK_OUTLINE), for rounded borders you use new Byte(Style.ROUND_OUTLINE)

.

See the types specified for the different types in the getDefault() method documentation/p>

Parameters:
propId - the id of the property being set
val - the value for the attribute being set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the property id is not a member of the valid property ids or the value object is of the wrong type e.g. Byte instead of Integer

getProperty

public java.lang.Object getProperty(byte propId)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns the property value for the specified property id for this Style. The property id must be one of the specified constants for properties in the Style class.

Parameters:
propId - the property ID for the property being requested
Returns:
the value for the property id requested
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the property id is not valid

loadStyle

public static Style loadStyle(java.io.InputStream is)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Loads a theme from a Theme file and packages it into a Style object so that it can be used in the application by making a call to the GlobalControl.setStyle() method. The theme file is a plain text file that has a simple and straight foward layout so that the application does not use so much memory trying to parse normal css or xml files. the theme files usually have a ftm (Flemil Theme) extension but any plain text document can be used. The Theme file is formatted in such a way that every attribute that can be set on a Style object is represented as a single line. See the demo application for a sample theme file and how they can be loaded into the application. Also its possible to create and preview themes on the Flemil website which you can download to your computer for use in application development or directly from the application on the mobile.

Parameters:
is - InputStream that contains the theme definition.
Returns:
a Style object representing the theme that was loaded from the InputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IOExceotion occurs reading from the InputStream

public byte[] toByteArray()
